intro: Aulospermum angustum, commonly known as narrowleaf heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its narrow, hairy leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in late spring to early summer. Aulospermum angustum is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
